image.caption: Collection of the U.S. House of Representatives

profileText: A Representative from Indiana; born near Coalmont, Clay County, Ind., March 8, 1882; attended the public schools and the Indiana State Normal School at Terre Haute; was graduated from the law department of Indiana University at Bloomington in 1907; was admitted to the bar the same year and practiced his profession in Terre Haute, Ind.; elected as a Republican to the Sixty-fifth and to the three succeeding Congresses (March 4, 1917-March 3, 1925); declined to be a candidate for renomination in 1924; was director of the speakers' bureau of the Republican National Committee in 1924; appointed secretary to President Calvin Coolidge on March 4, 1925, and served until March 4, 1929; served as Republican National Chairman from 1932 to 1934; resumed the practice of law in Washington, D.C., where he died May 12, 1950; interment in Highland Lawn Cemetery, Terre Haute, Ind.

researchRecord.name: 1913-1950, 200 items.
researchRecord.description: The papers of Everett Sanders contain correspondence, copies of speeches and articles, and printed matter. Includes 11 volumes of the reading copies of Coolidge's speeches, most of which relate to Republican Party policies and to the Presidential campaign of 1932. Also much personal correspondence between Sanders and Coolidge after the latter's term as President, and letters of or to other Republicans, including Herbert Hoover, Charles Evans Hughes, Theodore Roosevelt, Jr., and William Howard Taft.

researchRecord.name: In the Calvin Coolidge Papers, 1915-1932, approximately 179,000 items.
In the Charles Evans Hughes Papers, 1836-1950, 86 linear feet.
In the Luis A. Ireland Correspondence and Papers, 1910-1960, 3 boxes, 4 cartons, 1 oversize volume, and 1 oversize folder.
In the Berryman Family Papers, 1829-1984, 11.3 linear feet.
